names.pinyin: chai hu gui zhi gan jiang tang
names.english: bupleurum, cinnamon twig and ginger decoction
names.commonEnglish: Bupleurum, Cinnamon Twig and Ginger Decoction
aka: Bupleurum, Cinnamon Twig and Ginger Combination

actions: Resolves Shao Yang disorders, reduces fever, harmonizes the Exterior and Interior, disperses Wind-Heat and resolves Phlegm and congestion.
With Gan Cao, for hepatitis, upper right quadrant pain and Wind-Heat fever.

Releases the Exterior, assists Yang, adjusts the Ying and Wei, releases the muscle layer, unblocks Yang, transforms Qi and thin mucus, assists Heart Yang, warms and facilitates the flow of Yang Qi in the chest, warms the Middle and directs Turbid Yin downward.
With Chai Hu, for Tai Yang Stage moving to Shao Yang Stage.
Warms the Middle, expels Cold, dispels Wind-Dampness seeping into the Lower Jiao, expels Interior Cold, warms the Lungs and transforms thin mucus.
With Gan Cao, for epigastric pain and vomiting due to Spleen and Stomach Deficiency Cold.
Drains Heat, generates Fluids, clears and drains Lung Heat, transforms Phlegm, moistens Lung Dryness, relieves toxicity, expels pus and reduces swelling.
With Mu Li, for irritability and mental disorientation due to Lung and Stomach Yin Deficiencies and ascending Heat, with thirst.
Clears Heat, dries Dampness, drains Fire, detoxifies and calms ascending Liver Yang.
With Chai Hu, for Heat in the Shao Yang with alternating chills and fever and nausea.
Heavily settles, calms the Spirit, calms the Liver, benefits Yin, anchors Floating Yang, softens hardness, dissipates nodules and prevents leakage of fluids.
Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, moistens the Lungs, resolves Phlegm, stops cough, clears Heat, relieves Fire toxicity and moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs.
Harmonizes and releases the Shao Yang
Disperses clumping
Warms the Interior
Dispels Cold
Dispels water accumulation
Clears Heat
Moistens the Lungs
Astringes sweating
Relieves flushing up
syndromes: Shao Yang with Fluids Accumulating in the Interior
Malarial disorders with more chills than fever
Liver and Gallbladder Heat occurring simultaneously with Stomach Cold

symptoms: Pronounced chills with light fever or
A feeling of fullness and clumping in the chest and hypochondrium
manifestations.pulse: Wiry and tight on the left or Wiry and slow on the right or Thin and rapid or Irregular

contraindications: This formula is for mixed Excess and Deficiency it is contraindicated for pure Excess or pure Deficiency.

modifications.purpose: headache and perspiration on the head
